titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Henry Mitchell, Indictment
CWG4989

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Todd Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
Henry Mitchell

The Grand Jury of Todd County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: accuse Henry Mitchell of the offence of Selling Spritous Liquor to an infant. Committed as follows viz: The Said Henry Mitchell on the 20th day of August 1864 and at divers other times before and Since that time in the County aforesaid did Sell Spiritous Liquor to John Hester.. Said John Hester at the time bring and infant.- under twenty one years of age and without the written consent or request of the Father or Guardian of said infant. John Hester against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth
Information given by Merritt A. Christian Lemuel C. Glenn, John Hester

A copy attest
Ben T. Perkins Jr D. C.
for Ben T. Perkins C. T. C. C.

Commonwealth of Ky
vs } Copy of indictment
Henry MitchellA True Bill
U. C. Kennedy
Foreman Grand Jury
